segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 22
segments.en: Linked Discourses 22

segments.pli: 12. Dhammakathikavagga
segments.en: 12. A Dhamma speaker

segments.pli: 122. Sīlavantasutta
segments.en: 122. An Ethical Mendicant

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami … pe … etadavoca:
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita came out of retreat, went to Venerable Sāriputta, and said:

segments.pli: “sīlavatāvuso, sāriputta, bhikkhunā katame dhammā yoniso manasikātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, what things should an ethical mendicant properly attend to?”

segments.pli: “Sīlavatāvuso, koṭṭhika, bhikkhunā pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, an ethical mendicant should properly attend to the five grasping aggregates as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Seyyathidaṃ—rūpupādānakkhandho, vedanupādānakkhandho, saññupādānakkhandho, saṅkhārupādānakkhandho, viññāṇupādānakkhandho.
segments.en: That is, the grasping aggregates of form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.

segments.pli: Sīlavatāvuso, koṭṭhika, bhikkhunā ime pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: An ethical mendicant should properly attend to these five grasping aggregates as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.

segments.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ sīlavā bhikkhu ime pañcupādānakkhandhe aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi karonto sotāpattiphalaṃ sacchikareyyā”ti.
segments.en: It’s possible that an ethical mendicant who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of stream-entry.”

segments.pli: “Sotāpannena panāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā katame dhammā yoniso manasi kātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should a mendicant stream-enterer properly attend to?”

segments.pli: “Sotāpannenapi kho, āvuso koṭṭhika, bhikkhunā ime pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: “A mendicant stream-enterer should properly attend to these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.

segments.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ sotāpanno bhikkhu ime pañcupādānakkhandhe aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi karonto sakadāgāmiphalaṃ sacchikareyyā”ti.
segments.en: It’s possible that a mendicant stream-enterer who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of once-return.”

segments.pli: “Sakadāgāminā panāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā katame dhammā yoniso manasi kātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should a mendicant once-returner properly attend to?”

segments.pli: “Sakadāgāmināpi kho, āvuso koṭṭhika, bhikkhunā ime pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: “A mendicant once-returner should properly attend to these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.

segments.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ sakadāgāmī bhikkhu ime pañcupādānakkhandhe aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi karonto anāgāmiphalaṃ sacchikareyyā”ti.
segments.en: It’s possible that a mendicant once-returner who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of non-return.”

segments.pli: “Anāgāminā panāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā katame dhammā yoniso manasi kātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should a mendicant non-returner properly attend to?”

segments.pli: “Anāgāmināpi kho, āvuso koṭṭhika, bhikkhunā ime pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: “A mendicant non-returner should properly attend to these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.

segments.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ anāgāmī bhikkhu ime pañcupādānakkhandhe aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi karonto arahattaṃ sacchikareyyā”ti.
segments.en: It’s possible that a mendicant non-returner who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize perfection.”

segments.pli: “Arahatā panāvuso sāriputta, katame dhammā yoniso manasi kātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should a perfected one properly attend to?”

segments.pli: “Arahatāpi kho, āvuso koṭṭhika, ime pañcupādānakkhandhe aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, a perfected one should properly attend to the five grasping aggregates as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.

segments.pli: Natthi, khvāvuso, arahato uttari karaṇīyaṃ katassa vā paticayo;
segments.en: A perfected one has nothing more to do, and nothing that needs improvement.

segments.pli: api ca ime dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya ceva saṃvattanti satisampajaññāya cā”ti.
segments.en: Still, these things, when developed and cultivated, lead to blissful meditation in the present life, and also to mindfulness and situational awareness.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were…

suttaplex.blurb: Mahākoṭṭhita asks what an ethical mendicant should focus on, and Sāriputta replies that if they focus on aggregates as impermanent, etc. they may become a stream-enterer. A stream-enterer contemplating in the same way may become a non-returner, a once-returner, and a perfected one.
